name: Add a string to an array at a certain position
instruction:
The `addStr` function takes three parameters:
* `array` - array, contains strings
* `str` - string
* `n` - number.

The function must add the string `str` to the array by an ordinal number equal to the number `n`.

If the number `n` is greater than the length of the array, then add the string to the end of the array.

The function must return the changed array.

Examples of running the function:
```javascript
addStr(["x", "y", "z"], "a", 10) // ["x", "y", "z", "a"]
addStr(["a", "b", "c", "x"], "a", 2) // ["a", "a", "b", "c", "x"]
```
